sense.name: block a passageway or access, blockade
sense.commentary: Syntax Includes: NP1[agent] BLOCKADE NP2[patient[object]] Np1[agent] BLOCKADE NP2[location]
sense.examples: He blockaded her vehicle in his reserved spot. There he blockaded her till near Christmas, when she escaped, and the castle surrendered. The price of wheat soared when the French blockaded ships carrying supplies to Britian. About sixty thousand people blockaded the downtown streets.
